thread.title: New Yorkers experience the Second Avenue Subway’s opening weekend: photos
thread.title_full: New Yorkers experience the Second Avenue Subway’s opening weekend: photos

author: Amy Plitt
title: New Yorkers experience the Second Avenue Subway’s opening weekend: photos
text: Max Touhey It may have taken $4.5 billion and 100 years, but the Second Avenue Subway (part of it, anyway) is finally here. During its first couple of days, plenty of New Yorkers turned up to see what the fuss was all about—and, of course, documented their travels along the line on social media. A photo posted by Anna (@ahalpinhealy) on Jan 2, 2017 at 2:50pm PST A photo posted by Greg Zulkie (@gzulk) on Jan 1, 2017 at 12:12pm PST A photo posted by Noel Y. C. (@nyclovesnyc) on Jan 2, 2017 at 6:01am PST The artwork in the stations—by Jean Shin (63rd Street), Vik Muniz (72nd Street), Chuck Close (86th Street), and Sarah Sze (96th Street)—proved very popular with commuters. A photo posted by Allison Meier (@allisoncmeier) on Jan 1, 2017 at 3:34pm PST Muniz’s mosaics feature actual New Yorkers, some of whom posed with their idealized selves: A photo posted by Field Condition (@field_condition) on Jan 1, 2017 at 11:50am PST
